Welcome to the gastroenterology community!  If you do not have problems related to eating on a regular basis, it is unlikely that it is gastroparesis.  Have you had a gastric emptying scan?  Have you tried eating small frequent meals throughout the day that are low in fat and fiber?

question: During the day I am fine. At night, I get stomach aches concentrated on my left side. To get releif, I have to get up or sit up for a while, then I go back to sleep. But in another 2-3 hours, like clockwork,  same thing. I have had type 2 diabetes for a long time. My primary care doctor thinks I may have gastroparesis, but in a forum, people with that condiiton report much worse symptoms than I have, and they don't just say they have problems at night. They talk about heartburn/bloating, inability to eat, bad diarreea.  I don't have those, although I have had softer stools and a little diarrea lately.  Have an appt with a gastroenterologist in a month.  This started some years ago, but only once per night after a big meal, and getting up for a minute was enough. It has gotton worse last few months.
title: Stomach aches only at night
